Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great bath, awesome terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Joey_G_OKC
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews of this hotel prior to my departure cause me some distress. However, this was all relived the moment my wife and I stepped through the door! The older gentleman working the reception was very nice, and recommended the best restaurant in Rome, Il Tempio di Minerva!! The room was quite large compared to most roman hotel rooms, the bath was beautiful, and the patio that overlooked the terrace was AMAZING!!! The breakfast was typical roman, with no meats, but it did have good coffee and juices. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ShellCT0520
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was the hotel that was part of our package from the travel agency we booked with. After reading reviews online and checking the area out on Google maps, we thought we were in for the worst of it. We were pleasantly surprised when we actually got to the hotel. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful, the hotel and rooms were small but very clean (my husband and I had to sleep separately since we only had two less than twin size beds), the decor was really nice and well taken care of. The neighborhood was decent although a bit far from the city center, but close to metro stop so it was not difficult to get around. The only drawback to the hotel is the continental breakfast that is included. The coffee was horrible and all we were given to eat were rolls and croissants. It would have been nice if yogurt and fruit were part of the continental breakfast. We ended up going two blocks up to a local grocery store and buying breakfast food to have in our room.

Reviews.Title: “diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Holly M
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant after reading some reviews, to stay at this hotel. But, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is of the "boutique" variety, not large, but very pleasant. The rooms are lovely and of a decent size. The breakfast is minimal; coffee, juice and rolls. The location is not bad at all. Easy walk to the subway, and very accessible by bus. It is not in the center of the city, and there aren't a lot of restaurants nearby, but there are some. I didn't feel that the area was dangerous, as one reviewer suggested. And, I think that you can get a good price by booking online. I know we did.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location and subpar rooms”
Reviews.Author: Katherine E
Reviews.Content: We had a prepaid reservation and ended up spending to stay at a hotel in a better location. Unless you plan on taking the subway the entire time you are in Rome, the location is far from the center of town and there are very few restaurants and bars nearby. Upon checking in the concierge was extremely rude and refused to apologize or accommodate our reservation for one bed (our room had two twin beds and this was our honeymoon!). Once we arrived in our room the toilet flooded the bathroom the first time we used it. When we asked to have it fixed the man at the desk grumbled and moved us to another room (still with twin beds). When we inquired about the WiFi access he told us we had to pay and continued to mutter under his breath. Never once during our check-in process did he provide us with a map or welcome us. He was incredibly rude! Unfortunately, when we went back that evening to pick up our luggage to move to new hotel, the gentleman was very friendly and tried to make us feel welcome to stay. If we had met him upon check-in we may have had a totally different experience. We felt bad leaving because he was so kind and concerned (and a little confused as we had paid for two nights that we did not use). Also, the room does not have a mini-bar unless you consider a bottle of water in a dirty refrigerator a minibar. I would look for a better valued hotel in a better location before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a safe area....”
Reviews.Author: DonnaSebastian
Reviews.Content: You can walk to this hotel from the train station, it will only take about 20 minutes. The room was nice, as was the hotel staff, but the area is not safe. The buildings are covered with graffiti, men loiter in the streets while drinking from paper bags, and police sirens blare all night long. If I had to do it all over again I would get a hotel closer to the more popular areas and take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: Gingersnaps2
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying I paid $150 for three nights. I have stayed in more expensive hostels. Positive: super cheap if your lucky, location isn't horrible as long as your willing to walk 15 minutes to the sites, breakfast (cafe) is complimentary, close to osteria angelina, and rooms are quaint. Negative: breakfast is served in a dungeon, our room smelled like a portable toilet at a music festival, and if you plan on spending time in the room off of the bed I hope you don't need to bring asuitcase as one renders this impossible. All these would be manageable given the price (i would have planned on returning to the hotel) if not for the belligerent man who works behind the desk. When I first arrived he harassed me regarding not smoking in the room...i do not smoke. After accidentally spilling on my bed I was condesceningly reprimanded. The icing on the cake was when upon checking my bag I was told that "if I cared about what was in my bag I should carry it with me". The other employees were fantastic but the grumpy old man all but ruined our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcurelio
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is not what I would call a hotel. Let me explain: there's a line of trash dumpsters on the sidewalk close by. The Donatello is only one more of those dumpsters: it's claustrophobic and you are treated like garbage. The difference is that I guess the breakfast at the dumpsters may be slightly better. Don't waste your time with this so called hotel.

Reviews.Title: “my experience.”
Reviews.Author: Aveen M
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in December 2010. The rooms are tiny. I could not rotate my suitcase. I would recommend it only to tourists who have tours booked with their agents and who have pickup and drop off as it is difficult to get to the main city centre from this hotel. The surrounds of the hotel are unsound and don't reassure safety. The walls outside are covered in graffity. I would not stay there again. The staff however are friendly and helpful. Its just an inconveniently situated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a little off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Michael946
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days in Sept, overall we appreciated the hotel for what it was, a tourist class hotel. It has a 2 star rating, which I feel it right on. The rooms were smaller, but quite nice in appearance. The beds were firm, with extremely thin pillows. Our particular room overlooked the Grotto, where we had the complimentary breakfast; which is very good. Would we stay here again, not sure. If on a budget we probably would, if not, we would look for a nice 4 or five star location.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but overpriced for what it was”
Reviews.Author: Affinitz
Reviews.Content: Average rooms, needs some basic updates (bedspreads, curtains, etc). Service was just adequate as we were given incorrect instructions regarding busses, etc. (however excellent at breakfast) Location okay (15 min walk to metro) but not really central to main tourist district. We found this awkward as we would want to go back to our hotel during the afternoon siestas (when everything was closed) but it was a lot of traveling to head back to the touristy area in the evening. Overall, experience was okay, but not at 250 Canadian dollars per night

Reviews.Title: “its fine...”
Reviews.Author: greggandtheresa
Reviews.Content: We came from Venice and was driving down Italian cities when we noticed that the further down we went, the harder it was for us to get breakfast meats but that's ok. I have to say: you can't generalize the staff. Some of them were nice. Some of them were a bit too strange. To make a phone call even if the phone call did not go through is 20 cents, so don't even bother. The good thing was, it was so close to the bus stop that the distance from the centro is not that awful.

Reviews.Title: “Girl's Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: silvialoky
Reviews.Content: Me and my Friend stayed at Donatello Hotel this March for 3 nights . The Hotel I think is located in a Historical Building but renovated from the outside you can not see it because the front it's renovated . The Rooms are big we had 1 Triple room and 1 Dbl Room . The Triple room had also a nice Balcony . The Rooms were clean and the Maids came every day to clean them , change the towels etc . Even if the furniture is a bit run down it still works great . The Breakfast is a bit poor , you get Coffee/ Tea and Milk , 1 croissant / person , 2 kinds of Gem and some biscuits , so for the ppl that like to have a nice Breakfast is not so good . For us is was ok because we all use to have only Coffee in the Morning . The Rest. is used only for Breakfast you can not have Lunch or Dinner . Near the Hotel you have some Mini Market where you cab buy something extra if need it . From the Hotel to the nearest Metro station Manzoni you have to walk about 500 m .Do not worry about the Neighborhood because it is safe we were 5 Girls and han no trouble or felt unsafe . The Staff is very Friendly and helpful the give you free Maps of Rome if you ask , give you directions an how to get around the town etc . In conclusion me and my Friends had a very good time at Hotel Donatello and recomand it to all that want to visit the beautiful city of Rome .

Reviews.Title: “It was a place to rest our head but dont think Id stay again....”
Reviews.Author: herburlness
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I went on a trip to Rome and Florence earlier this year. We booked it through Gate One and got quite a fantastic deal. We opted not to upgrade the rooms because last year we went to Ireland and were very happy with hotel in our package. We didnt spend alot of time in the room so it was tolerable. The Pros...The room was small but had a lovely balcony with table and chairs overlooking the busy street the hotel sat on. At first the location seemed out of the way. But it was a short walking distance to the subway and bus which made it quite convienent. Some of the front desk staff were very nice and helpful...others not so much. The cons....The beds were incredibly hard and the pillows flat. The toliet clogged up daily and we had to call the front desk. We were given linen cloths not towels for the bathroom. Which I thought may have been a cultural thing. But once we got to Florence we had nice fluffy towels! One night we had booked at tour that didnt arrive back until late. When we arrived the doors were locked and we could not get inside. We rang the bell and continually knocked while standing outside in the cold and rain for 20 minutes after 11pm at night until we were let in. They know when everyone is in for the night because you have to turn your key into them anytime you leave. Because of that he knew what room was ours before we even asked, which made it worse. It was our first time, but if I choose to go back to Rome (and that is a big if) I will choose to stay at a different location.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, But I wouldn't go back!”
Reviews.Author: Sanjra11
Reviews.Content: Being of Italian (both my partner and I) and also being able to understand and speak limited Italian we found we were treated with a different level of respect compared to other guests. The hotel room was a bit on the small side, so it encourages you to get out. The location is probably the biggest let down. Walking around at night seemed unsafe, as it was 30-45min walk away from all the Rome hot spots. Internet is not free here! Breakfast is served between 7:30-9:30 so if you are not an earlier riser you will miss it. (just like we did) Plus sides to the hotels location include; a little pizzeria and some small cafes around the corner. & up the road (on the same street) is the Gelato Factory. And if you are staying during the middle of Summer here is a tip; Pre-set your air conditioner so when you get back after being in the heat you will be glad you did so. (the hotel turn the air-conditioning system on around 1pm)

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, wouldnt stay again though”
Reviews.Author: nkearns
Reviews.Content: Without boring you with a long story - I was with my 18 yr old daughter and was given a basement room with a lanai that was below and accesable to street level, when I asked for another room then next morning, because of several factors Safety bbeing the most-, they did not want to comply, but I was insistant and they did change my room. The next room was a lot shabbier on the 4th floor, whereas my traveling companions were also on the 4th floor in a deluxe room. it was very irritating that we paid the same price and got glaringly different rooms, - my 1st room onthe basement was also not as nice- but better than the 2nd room. marble floors, old showers , old beds, terrible desks to store our clothes in, inadequate. the worst was the breakfast. After just leaving Paris with a wonderful breakfast each day, here we were offered 1 croissant and 1 hard roll with butter and jam. Hard to make that last when you are walking for hours each day. The staff was nice, but not accomidating, I asked them to make a call for me as I was afraid I wouldnt understand the other party and they would not. 3 euros bought 15 MINUTES of internet time, kind of ridiculous. I wouldnt stay here again, the neighborhood doen not have any good restaurants or cafes, there are a couple - but we didnt want to go to any of them, It is about 1 mile or so from the colliseum, I would stay closer to the center there near a Hop on HOp off bus stop - probably if I went back. There was however the best grocery store up just 3 blocks and a nice restaurant which we ate at two times just one block up from the supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Sewage smell”
Reviews.Author: llc2009
Reviews.Content: Small family run hotel. Staff are generally nice and knows how to speak English. However, I'd stay away from this hotel during rainy seasons such as late Autumn. Our room was on the second floor facing the street. The sewage smell was strong to the point that we had to open the window all the time (it's rather noisy at night with the Tram running) and had to sprayed room sanitizer (still smelly). Talked to the staff but they always told us the hotel is fully booked. Breakfast is very basic: rolls, coffee, and juice. As for location, it's rather convinient, but the nearest subway station is 15min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful-Clean room- not the best location- unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 2ticos
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was part of a package and therefore cannot comment on the price/value equation. The hotel is off the beaten path and there if nothing to do around the neighborhood at night. The area is a little shady at night. The room we stayed at was beautiful, spacious and very clean. It was located on the fourth floor and facing a very busy street. It was a very noisy room during the day and early evening. The breakfast was simple - coffee, terrible OJ, croissant- bread, butter and jelly. Much inferior than your typical offering at other hotels. We spent little time at the hotel, leaving early in the am and returning late in the pm- much to see and do in Rome. My only problem was that the staff was not helpful at all. The metro is about a 10 minute walk and there is tram that passes right in from of the hotel, with a stop much closer than the metro. The metro line was under construction and closed at night after 9.00pm during all our stay and days after. The staff never advised us of this and our options of taking the 40-64 bus to Termini and than taking the tram back to the hotel. (with a free transfer!!!!) Knowing what I know now, I would stay at this hotel again only of the price is right and after analyzing other options.....

Reviews.Title: “Dont go here!”
Reviews.Author: momberk
Reviews.Content: Front desk persons were not helpful and "stuffy". Felt like we were a bother when we arrived, and when asking for a suggestion for a place to have dinner. The rooms were clean, and small, but had a distinct odor. The "pillow" (if you want to call it that) were about as thick as a towel when folded. When I asked if we could have another, the front desk told me I would have to track down the maid and ask her. The breakfast was nothing to brag about either. Just a few "hard" rolls and cousiants with jelly. The part of town was a little shady.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, some staff members less than ideal”
Reviews.Author: interprete16
Reviews.Content: The hotel is still undergoing renovation but is now almost complete. The room we stayed in was beautiful; well appointed, functional, and very quiet. Undoubtedly, the owners have incurred considerable expense to make it so. The pleasure of the physical beauty, however, is quickly negated by the experience of having to deal with some members of the staff. With three notable exceptions, which I will duly praise later, I found the staff to be only superficially polite, having the thinnest veneer of an agreeable personality. A condescending attitude towards the guests is not conducive to repeat business. Telling a guest that his coffee only "seems" cold because the guest, obviously, doesn't understand how a thermos bottle works is just wrong. When the response to even the simplest routine requests is a frown and the quickly worn-out phrase "We'll see what we can do", that is also not conducive to repeat business. Maybe they are under a lot of pressure, maybe they are just tired, bored, or ill, but whatever the reason, the guest deserves better. Three members of staff were conspicuously different; Luis was a delightful, charming, man, a joy to work with. Bernardo was a soft-spoken, mild-mannered, somewhat easily flustered by deviations from the routine but having a very pleasant attitude. And Giovanni, a young man, which took a little warming up to to get him out of his shell, a little diamond in the rough, but was real. The hotel is in a working class neighborhood, a little run-down, with lots of grafitti everywhere, but I felt safe walking the nearby streets after dark. A lot of working people, mostly immigrants, going about their life, minding their own business. The buses run right by the hotel, the Metro is not too far, and there is a supermarket two blocks away. If a beautiful room is your only criteria for the desirability of a hotel then the Donatello fits the bill, but for me it isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: k62778
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing like most of the pictures or the website. While our room was spacious and had a wonderful veranda, the rest of the stay was horrible. The staff were extremely unhelpful. You felt as if you were putting them out by asking for recommendations or help. The breakfast, while typical, was poor. Terrible coffee, juice that tasted like Tang, and bread. The neighborhood is in the middle of Chinatown. Tons of grafitti and not convenient to the metro lines. I would definitely choose a different hotel if I were to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not quite like the website :(”
Reviews.Author: joam124
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Europe.......Athens Rocks, Crete ok, Santorini BEAUTY BEYOND COMPARE Rome....a bit over rated and most especially the Hotel Donatello.........so not like we were lead to believe by the website.......the pictures of dining and the bar..........uh........didn't really happen, was in a very trashy area.........rooms tiny BUT very clean, the staff was nice enough sorta............breadfast was coffee and bread/rolls..........that's it, however it was included in the price of the very small room...they said they hoped to have the restaurant bar open soon..........ummmmmmmm it looked open on the website. Anyway there we NO Bedbugs ;-) and life is still good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: alisonharris123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel donatello for 3 nights. We found it to be a comfortable, well kept hotel and the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was served outside in the small garden- we had a flask of coffe, croissant each and a bread roll, very nice. It is a little walk to the nearest metro stop but we found it to be convenient enough for exploring the city. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and would stay again on return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, bad location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: bkim056
Reviews.Content: Service was appaling. The hotelier in the night shift was very kind, but the hotelier in the morning shift was extremely unkind, or racist? i don't know. Rooms were immaculately clean with lovely furniture, wall papers but bad location, had to walk long distance from Termini station. Loved the rooms, but I guess staying at the hotel is all about service. friendly service would increase the value of the hotel. I would recommend it if they offer kind, friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarkWidow
Reviews.Content: Hotel Donatello is located two metro stations away from the Termini metro station (which is not only the railway station, but also the connection between the two metro lines), so it is easy to reach. Hotel Donatello is also located very near several bus and tram stations, which also help you get to Termini, so, again, getting around the city should not prove to be a problem during your stay. I did not find the neighborhood to be shady at all. It was not glamorous, but there were no bad vibes about it either, so I really do not understand anyone else’s concern about the “bad part of town”. The hotel itself is quite small, as are the rooms, however, as I understand it, that is pretty much the norm in Italy. On the other hand, our room was clean, and had a somewhat simple elegance to it, especially due to the marble finishing and tasteful furniture. The beds were comfortable, we cooled off thanks to the air conditioning (although they only turn it on after 1 p.m. from the reception, as they state that it is cool enough before that time) and the bathroom, although almost incredibly small, provided us with everything we needed. The bath towels were a bit shocking though, as they were not towels at all, but were, in fact, made of something that resembled table cloth material, however, they did get you dry in the end. The only downside was that the changing of the towels was random at best, as we were left with the same large dirty towel for three days in a row, while all the others had been changed. The room was nice and comfortable and the small balcony with a table for two was a very nice surprise, although we did not get to take advantage of it during our trip. The best part of our experience with Hotel Donatello was the place where they serve breakfast. It is a lovely setting at the very base of the building (under the street level) where they have a small terrace with tables and seats surrounding an artificial fountain (just a wall with water running down on it, but the sound of the trickling water is very relaxing), and everything is covered by these beautiful climbing plants with large pink flowers that gracefully fall into the water or on the ground as you enjoy your meal. They also have very nice replicas of Roman statues set on the walls on one side, and a view to the garden on the other side (where some of the neighborhood cats like to perform tricks for you), which really completes the look to perfection. There is also indoor seating available that is just as inviting, although I was not able to part with the romantic atmosphere I could enjoy outside. Breakfast is very simple: bread rolls, croissants, butter, jams and honey and you can serve it with any type of coffee (although simple coffee and some milk proved to be the best choice, as the other types of coffee weren’t really all that strong), black tea or orange juice. Breakfast itself was fine, but everything that was available was sweet and we were pretty much fed up with the same jam and honey every day considering we had been eating the same thing for our whole six-day trip there. A simple saltshaker or a small piece of cheese would have probably done the trick, but when in Rome, do as the Romans do. The service was great, particularly the receptionists, as pretty much every customer staying at their hotel came down to ask questions about sights and how to get to them every day and the people working at the front desk were very friendly and helpful and spoke various foreign languages, making communication very easy. They answered all of our questions, googled the information we requested, provided us with a map of Rome on our arrival and underlined all the places we needed to see, as well as how to get there, they pointed out streets on the map when we wanted to go shopping and even held our luggage for free when we checked out on the last day. All in all, this is a decent hotel for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A real treasure in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Bazzerr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Donatello for four nights and although not in the centre of all the touristy bits, it was a wonderful little hotel. All the staff were helpful in both hotel requests and where to visit. On foot, not that far from the attractions but use public transport for the Vatican. Good public transport from outside the hotel into the central area. Rooms were clean and tidy with towels changed every day. Breakfast was adequate, continental, and you can request more. Graffiti around the area but no worries about the location. Locals friendly and nearest restaurants were all great and ten minutes on foot. Would use again on next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: girlinmaine04043
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome yesterday after spending the last 3 nights in Italy at the Hotel Donatello and were very very disappointed. When I was planning our trip I read many reviews and even though I knew that the location wasn't the best I was led to believe that the rooms were nice and that the front desk staff was exceptional. Neither of those things were true. We had two rooms (total of 4 of us) and our friends room was fairly nice (room #409) with a good amount of room and a nice little balcony. Our room (room #404) however was horrible..small, dark and not the cleanest. The front staff (specifically Renaldo) were rude and condesending.Trying to get simple directions or assistance was impossible. PLEASE take my advice and spend a few more dollars and stay at a much nicer hotel. Between everything I have said and the fact that the area is shady at best, you should really choose a better place to stay! I would NEVER stay there again or even consider visiting that part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JBaker50
Reviews.Content: Mauro delightful and very helpful. Unfortunately we did not receive the same level of service from the other desk staff. Rooms needed a good airing and a good cleaning. Beds were comfortable. From the website and brochure we expected a bar and evening restaurant. Neither of which were available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: e_katy_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel it`s about 10 minutes walk from the underground station Manzoni. We had 2 triple rooms. One it was not a really triple room because it was very small and the third bad was introduced in the day of our arrival. The second room it was a triple one, very spacious, with three same beds and even with a terrace. We stay there 2 nights. In the next day the rooms have been cleaned, the towels and the sheets have been changed. The breakfast consisted in: thea, coffee, milk, juice, toast, croissants, butter and jam/honey. The staff was friendly. We arrived there before the hour for the check-in but they gave us one room to let our bags. Also they gave us a map and they marked on it the hotel and the sights and they make us some sugestions of what to visit each day. In a few words it was a good location (also not far away from the center). Katy

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: karw
Reviews.Content: While this family owned/operated hotel is not in the best neighborhood, it's location is great for getting around by train, tram or on foot. Nothing plush, just basic but clean and accomodating. Rooms are snug as well as baths and hot water in shower takes awhile to warm up. No washcloths and towels are more like linen tea towels but good value for the money. No air conditioning and included breakfast is very simple with rolls, jams/honey, juice, coffee, tea.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: rabbitbun
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about some of the bad reviews, but were happy we chose this hotel. The staff was extremely nice and friendly, the rooms were not as small as expected and very quiet and clean. It doesn't offer a buffet breakfast, if anyone was expecting that :) , instead you get some croissants, bread and butter and coffee. I didn't think the location was that bad considering the price, it's about 10 min walk, almost a straight line to the nearest metro station. Again i must point out the great reception staff, it was during the volcano flights mess up and they were very helpful in helping tourists with information. Definitely will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location”
Reviews.Author: jobib
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about how close it was to the train station. In reality it is about a 15 minute walk and you pass 50 other hotels on the way here. Everything that people said about the owners and the charm of the hotel was true. It is a really lovely, typical 3-star Italian hotel. I have stayed at much worse. The two biggest issues: First the street noise is really terrible. I am a deep sleeper and I was up on and off most of the night. Second, the neighborhood really has no redeeming qualities. There are much nicer parts of Rome to stay in. I almost turned around when I was walking here from the train; thinking I had made a mistake. I was here for the night only because of the volcano cancelling my flights and I have been to Rome many times, so I thought it was perfect for what I needed. If I was here to experience Rome, I would have wanted to be in a different part of town.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great personnel”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne85
Reviews.Content: i came back from rome today, about 7 hours ago and i really wanted to write on tripadvisor about this hotel. Donatello Hotel is very very NICE, the personnel is kind and very helpful,and the position of the hotel is good, about 7 minutes away from manzoni metro station, 12 minutes from termini. It was great and cheap! very clean, also. the man an the front desk helped us with maps and indications, he even made phonecalls when he didnt know what we were asking him. the breakfast was poor, but we didnt mind because we know that italian dont eat too much at breakfast. if i will go back in rome i'd surely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jpj171
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Donatello was more than we expected. It was wonderful! To begin, we are retired, we did not go to Rome for hotel amenities -- we went to see Roma! The hotel is relatively small by Western standards, not the "big box" hotel, and it is not at all short on caring service or subdued elegance. Two things we find most important in a hotel are cleanliness and safety. Hotel Donatello is perfect. Impeccable! We were so comfortable! Owner Carlo, his son Mauro, desk clerk Giovanni and the staff were so very kind and helpful. Access to public transportation right outside the door. The Colliseum just a short distance away. We will definitely stay there again when we again go to Roma! It was the most Wonderful trip, and Hotel Donatello helped make that true!! PS Happy Birthday on March 23rd and 25th, Carlo and Mauro!

Reviews.Title: “Great informative service! Mauro at the front desk was excellent”
Reviews.Author: cydnee0521
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and found the location fairly central. The accomodations were nice. The people at the front desk were very helpful. Not a five store hotel but for a trip on a budget it was quite accomodating. The staff was nice, the rooms were clean , and near the train station. It was walking distance to all of rome's attractions. But bring your walking shoes. IT was the best hotel out of the three we stayed in on our ten day trip to venice, florence, and rome. We booked through Gate 1 travel. I would recommend and again the service from Mauro was excellent and the staff speaks various languages.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel very reasonably along with Alitalia flights. The location is fine, about 10 minutes by tram from Termini. The street doesn't look great, but it's pretty clean and safe. The lobby is good, the front desk, Carlo and Patricia super nice. Breakfast is good coffee and milk, rolls and croissants. Everything fresh. The room was okay, nothing fancy, functional. Two beds placed together, a modern bathroom, with very good hot shower. The walls are a little thin. All in all, a good bargain, great place to stay, if you, like me, don't spend alot if time in a room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Saulius_LT
Reviews.Content: I think this is perfect hotel if you want to explore Rome for a weekend. The location is very good (within a walking distance to the Terminus, plus tram line in front of the hotel). When searching Rome information on the internet, there is full info about busses and metro but virtually no info about the tram lines that are really helpful. Even in the metro there is virtually no info on trams. The most helpful from busses/trams is #3 which can bring you to most of the Touristic places - Colloseum/Forum, Trastevere, Villa Giulia, Laterano bus station from where bus to catacombs goes, etc. The staff is very friendly and speaks good English, can give good advice on Rome travel hints. When asked they have provided us with a room with double bed (although the booking said only twin beds are available). The area is not at all bad as other reviewers suggest, it's not touristic but other than that there are small 24/7 shops around, supermarket, internet shop and good restaurants in 3 minutes of walking distance. When booking I was somewhat cautious about the noise from the railway line but we had a room to that side and there were no problems because of that. The hotel has small yard with palm, some rooms even have small patios (ours didn't). Cons: breakfast is VERY basic (no meat or cheese), although coffee is pretty good. Sound insulation is quite bad, yet that didn't disturb us too much. We spend there 5 nights, once one of the new towels had fresh blood stains - quite strange.. ventillation in the bathroom was basically non existant. the stairs in the middle might be somewhat uncomfortable for elder travelers but for us it didn't make a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel just be aware of neighborhood if walking at night”
Reviews.Author: shrmnr
Reviews.Content: This inexpensive little hotel near the main train station was a in a prime location for us. Since Rome only has two metro lines we needed to be close to a metro stop and this was close enough. The rooms were average size (by European standards) and clean. The bathroom was small but clean. No problems with staff and cleanliness...linens changed every day if requested. Breakfast was mostly breads and cereals but coffee was great. Staff was very friendly and their English was better than mine, lol. Very helpful when asking about sightseeing and directions for bus, streetcar or metro. Talked us out of a cab when we left and suggested we walk to train station and they were right, it was close enough to walk. The only caution I would give is the neighborhood at night. By day it's just a working class neighborhood and easy and comfortable to get around. But at night you will see the occasional bum/homeless/drunk on the sidewalk. We never had a problem but I would make sure you are aware of your surroundings...typical stuff you would do in a large city. There are several cafes & restaurants within walking distance so the lack of a restaurant at the hotel should not be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Travelinganna
Reviews.Content: I booked the Donatello as a package with an agency and wasn't sure what to expect. To complicate matters, I picked up bronchitis in Paris just before arriving, making sure I could barely walk, let alone speak Italian. Mauro checked us in. He's smoking hot and speaks perfect English and is an amazing gentleman. He walked us to our room and circled a bunch of local highlights, including his favorite nearby bakery, on a map for us. Though it looks far on the map, the hotel is in decent walking distance from the Coloseum. Also nearby is Termini- take the bus right outside the hotel instead of transfering to the A train, which never seems to be running. The breakfast is traditional croissants and buns with jam, coffee, and juice. I'm Italian American and this is what my grandparents ate. If you need hashbrowns you should probably not visit Rome. On our last night I was feeling well enough to eat and smoking hot Mauro not only recommended a fab restaurant nearby but made the reservation and had the proprietor meet us at the door. About our room: small but sufficient with mini fridge, large bathroom, tv and balcony. Had I not been coughing up a lung, I'd been out there. There is supermarket and a few restaurants nearby. Area looked a lil skiddish at night but locals were always around. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, and Lovely innkeeper Bernardo”
Reviews.Author: caligirl2930
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Donatello and it's lovely Bernardo by way of our scheduled B&B owner Baci da Roma being a total flake, and waste. Hotel Donatello has lovely rooms with balconies, and tons of space for Rome. There is a charming continental breakfast. We walked in and the rate was only 100eu. not too bad. There is a charming restaurant called "The crazy chicken" underground, inexpensive undergound. Make sure you meet Bernardo. Would easily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: crestheaven
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was simple, and clean, with friendly staff, adequate breakfast, and located in an authentic Roma neighborhood. It's ordinary, shuttered, stucco exterior housed very clean and spacious rooms. The bath was recently remodled, and the windows were new. The bath was large and all marble. We really felt like local residents, shopping at the market, stopping for cappacino at the local coffee bar, and walking to the metro. Mauro at the front desk was welcoming and informative. There is a lovely, home cooking trattoria just accoss the street. I would definately stay here again. The price was great too. We felt very European and less American living just feet from antiquity.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: daglis95
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Rome and I truly had the best time of my life. The Donatello Hotel is really a great hotel the staff was very accomodating and pleasant . The went out of their way to assit you with all your travelling needs and concerns. For example my friend and I got lost in the city and we missed our prepaid tour when we got back to the hotel the gentleman in the front desk called the company and got us reserve for a tour the next day that is really good service The rooms are small but they are very clean. The Donatello experience was truly great dont let the Grafitti around the hotel scare you because you will see that around Rome a lot.

Reviews.Title: “We recomend and will come back”
Reviews.Author: Licastro
Reviews.Content: We liked the place. The staff was very nice and gave us all information we need. They keep our luggages in a adeposit whe we checked out. Excellente hotel. We will come back

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carlost75
Reviews.Content: I totally recommend this hotel! It was our first time in Italy, traveling on a budget and we couldn't have asked for anything better. First, don't be fooled by the picture of the entrance to the hotel. Unfortunately, Rome is plagued by graffiti. When I first saw the outside in person I was scared because of the graffiti but once you walk in, the experience is completely different. The hotel is a boutique hotel that is very charming and the decor is very italian. It gives the feeling of an old palazzo. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They spoke english very well and if they didn't they tried very hard to communicate in english which was a pleasant surprise. Our room was cozy and faced the back of the hotel overlooking a very nice terrace. Now, the hotel is on a very busy street so make sure you book a room that faces the back so you wont get all the street noise. As I said, our room was very cozy and the bathroom facilities looked new. Bring your own towels as Europeans use bath sheets. For us, Americans, its weird to use a sheet to dry off. I cant express how friendly the staff was. The continental breakfast was decent. We took advantage of it since we were traveling on a budget. The location of the hotel is excellent. Its a few blocks from buses and trolleys and in walking distance from a train station called Manzoni. Take the train everywhere!! Its really worth it! The hotel supplies you with a decent map of the city upon check-in. Checking in and out was hassle free. As a matter of fact, we arrived so early in the morning and our room was ready (we were in Rome during off season). There was a charming young man at the front desk I cant recall his name. He is Italian but lived in the UK for 5 years. His service was superb!!! You can't miss him. His english was fantastic!! Please visit this hotel. Don't expect frills its not the Four Seasons but the service, quality and cleanliness of the hotel is totally worth it. I would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Jumpinjack3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Rome for a three day stay. We arrived at our hotel from the airport without difficulty thanks to a wonderful taxi driver. Our greeting upon entering the lobby was great! The staff were helpful and checked right into our room. Our room was adequate and clean with a nice shower area. The hotel is located on a bus line and within walking distance to the subway. The only problem we had was with the night staff person. He was not just unfriendly but actually mean. I asked him for directions and he scrawled some lines on a map and threw it across the desk to me. Maybe, threw is a little strong it was more like a forcible push, but the intention was there. When we got outside the hotel we were still a bit confused and my wife suggested that I go back in for further directions. I was so intimidated by him that I said that "I'm not going back in there" and we sorted out the path on our own. I worked the desk at hotels during my youth and if anyone ever treated a guest the way that we were treated they would have been fired on the spot. One other thing, the breakfast. A roll, juice and coffee. That's it!!!! Having said all that the day staff were wonderful, helpful, friendly and willing to go out of their way to answer or questions and concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: JillB14
Reviews.Content: hav stayed here a couple of times and enjoyed it each time. It isa really charming hotel in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: HolidayMaker047
Reviews.Content: Made to feel welcome on arrival. Room fairly small and over looking road, the drivers seem to like using their horns over here so a bit noisy, but otherwise a quiet hotel. Breakfast was very dissapointing even for continental. There was no choice, your just given 1 roll 1 croissant 1 butter and jam each with a pot of tea or coffee. We took a travel Kettle and got our own provisions from the nearby supermarket. There is not much of a choice of restaurants in the immediate area but it's only a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro and Spagna was quite lively although very few 'pubs' you have to use the cafe's if you want to drink. The hotel is not as near to the sites as the description leads you to belive but it's very easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: DipaP
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cheaper hotels to stay in Rome hence why I picked it. It's not bad for the money. The location is just outside the central touristy part of Rome - about 20min walk to the Colosseum and further to the Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps. Recommend to get the metro to the Vatican. Fairly near the Termini train station so easier to get to the airport. Area seems quite run down with lots of graffiti. Hotel itself was ok - staff were absolutely lovely, very helpful and friendly. Poor points include the paper thin walls which we experience our 2nd night there when the couple next door decided to make a very long and very loud telephone call. Breakfast is meagre - tea/coffee and a croissant and roll. Overall not bad though.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary, overpriced, poorly located in a dodgy area”
Reviews.Author: aldeb001
Reviews.Content: Needed to get a taxi or walk for long distances as local transport poor. Getting ripped off by taxi from station didn't help. Staff not particularly helpful for everything...in all, our worst hotel for our Europe trip....would stay closer to Spanish Steps next time...pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Old building, immaculately clean, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Eirelav73
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Donatello last month. It was a 3-night stay for our honeymoon before we headed on to Sorrento. On first arriving to the hotel I felt disappointed in the location, firstly the distance to the centre of town and then the street it was on. It looked rough on first arriving. However, as soon as we entered the front door we were greeted by a very friendly man who gave us very detailed descriptions and a map of Rome and how to get around etc. The hotel itself is very beautiful, although it is more like a guesthouse, it's an old building but has a beautiful, pretty feel to it. Our room was spotless, although small but that didn't matter. There were staff at the front desk 24-7 that could not do enough for you, extremely friendly and helpful at all times. Breakfast was very basic, a bread roll and croissant with coffee every morning, but again, you get what you pay for I guess. The distance from the centre of Rome was a little bit of an inconvenience, however, I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeevesCostadelSol
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, who are around 60, wanted a low price comfortable hotel near the centre of Rome. The Donatello more than provided this: the room was not large but was well appointed with safe, fridge, plenty of clothes storage, and very comfy firm bed. The bathroom was small but had excellent shower, bidet, and hair dryer, as well as normal fittings. The location is not noisy, and it is very convenient for buses. There are plenty of cheap eating places within a short walk. the breakfast area in the garden is delightful and the breakfast is standard continental, but very adequate. All of the staff are friendly, speak good English, and are very helpful. We would definitely use the hotel again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “bad! they don't keep room for us even we already booked and paid!”
Reviews.Author: mina_zy
Reviews.Content: when I arrived to the hotel ,they told us they don't have any room for us, and took us to another hotel named "hotel bled", that hotel's room was small and wet. So I'm not satisfied about Hotel Donatello, maybe I paid so cheap (63 euro per day),so they don't want us to live in? even we already paid before our arriving.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a 3 star.”
Reviews.Author: JR2020
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Immediately impressed with welcome, owners very helpful and polite. Full of info about what to see and where to go and eat. Located 15 mins from both Termini and Colosseum, very safe area, unlike what was suggested by other traveller below who must have spent their time walking in the immediate locality of the train station. Anyway, all staff great, good breakfast in quality and quantity in beautiful courtyard. Great view from window (4th floor back of hotel). Secure safe etc. 24 hour porter. Good tram, bus, and metro service (5 mins walk to manzoni, on red line). Only negative is that shower is a bit small, but bathroom itself is fine. Very well priced. Defo recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KilkennyPaddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Donatello hotel in rome for 3 days and nights 21st-23rd june and found it to be a very charming little hotel with very friendly staff always ready to help. It was spotlessly clean and the rooms were of good size. I don't know what breakfast was like cos I never eat it. Its located about halfway between the colloseum and Termini railway station so thats about a 20 minute walk to the centre of Rome. The area looks a bit dodgy but it is safe and looks a lot worse than it actually is but late at night you would probably be wise to get a taxi back( but I think thats the case in any big city in the world). I really enjoyed my stay in the Donatello and would absolutely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: MikeJaquie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay and would have no worries about staying there again.Staff were helpful and very friendly,Hotel and rooms were spotless and the breakfast of rolls,coissants and jams were more than adequate to start the day.Restaurant and bar do not seem to be used but then Rome is a city to be enjoyed at night as well as the day and you can always stick a few drinks in the fridge in your room. Although the Hotel is outside the city centre the transport system in Rome is second to none! The 105 bus stops on the corner of the street on your left about 30mtrs from the hotel entrance and runs to the Termini Station (bus,train,metro underground and open top bus tours)tickets can be purchased from the Tabacco shop about 20mtrs past the bus stop ask for metrobus ticket.The bus runs approx EVERY 5 MINUTES. Tickets:a BIT ticket allows you to use the bus and metro for 75 minutes from purchase ideal for one way travel and costs 1 euro per person,a BIG ticket is for 24 hours unlimited use on bus and metro and costs 4 euros per person. The no 3 bus runs from the opposite corner and goes to the Colloseum and into the Traverse area of Rome that isn't covered by the metro. The open top buses are an ideal way to see the city and we used TOUR ROME who have a 15 minute service leaving the Termini Station opposite where the 105 stops. Metro very easy to use and a cheap alternative to the open top bus.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little new hotel”
Reviews.Author: trish30
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday night- welcomed by a very friendly gentleman. Once all our details were taken he proceeded to tell us that they had a problem with their water and that we had to stay in a hotel accross the road- Hotel Porta Maggiora. In exchange for us spending the night in a different hotel he said he would give us an extra nice room! The Hotel Porta Maggiora was clean however not up to the standard of Hotel Donatello-single beds with lots of noise early in the morning. We quickly got over the mix up of the first night and checked in to our originally booked room on the Saturday morning. Our room was ready by 10 and we were shown directly to our room by a very friendly lady. Overall the hotel seemed newly re-docerated with a very modern but Italian, fresh clean feel to it. Our room was small however this was the only complaint- it was perfectly clean with nice new bathroom facilities, we had a lovely balcony and a very comfortable double bed. The room had its own safe and provided water in the mini-bar. It had shutters and big balcony doors which were double glazed so all noise and light was blocked out. There was little choice for breakfast (croissant and bread roll) but again staff extremely friendly and restaurant very clean and new. Its location for us was perfect-within walking distance from the colosseum and 5 min walk from Manzoni metre station. Be warned we got a taxi from Termini on the 1st night (15 min walk) and it cost us 20 euro- 8.50 for us and the rest for our 2 small bags!! On the last day we checked out however they kept our bags for the day. It did not have any area to relax in other than your hotel room at night- however we ventured back to the bar at hotel portamaggiora. Overall Hotel Donatello a very friendly, clean and nicely decorated hotel. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to like this hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: soloonthego
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Just got back from a 4-nite stay above, read all the reviews & thought I made a smart choice--I was wrong. I'm writing this to assist others who are considering options as I did. Would be OK for a nite or two for single traveler, otherwise I'd stay elsewhere. First, location is at least a 10-15min walk from Termini, seedy crowd, homeless sleeping on the streets after hours or early morning please note. The pics of the front entrance shown are decieving, there's only a 2x2' sign w/ the hotel name, underneath is the sliding glass door entrance. Safe, secure, but as mentioned w/ a few other posts, not located in the nicest of areas, a couple of decent restaurants & made use of the Supermarket at Manzoni which has anything you need, this is a plus, much cheaper than buying a soda at the restaurants (.65eu compared to 1.50-3.00eu). As for the staff, I'd say it depends on who you are lucky enough to have at the front desk. I booked & prepaid thru the web & upon check in was handed a map, male scribbled in pen for 30secs to show the highlites & was escorted to my room. (Asked a female working the desk 1 day prior to leaving to arrange a taxi for me, said the hotel taxi was 50eu, otherwise I would have to call my own. Later, asked a male the same question, he said no problem, will call you a taxi upon checkout (early a.m) will be here in 5mins (took me to the airport for 40 eu)..While the rooms are nice & generally clean/comfortable, size is small as are the double beds (I'm 5-8 & feet hung over the edge, tried to push them together, but everytime I turned, the bed moved & made noise on the marble floor. Walls are thin, could hear next room's conversation. A nearby couple was cking out early one morning & decided to roll their luggage down the marble stairs (waking everyone else)..Shower (no tub) is at most 2x2' (everytime I moved, my elbow hit & turned off the water). No washcloths, just a small towel for shower. My TV was a 12" w/10 channels (satellite?), obviously made in the '70s w/ a button missing. There is a small minibar-fridge. No fan or air conditioning, couldn't change the temperature, which led to opening the bathroom window (bars on the outside luckily), which in turn let in the noise from the street. As mentioned in other posts, Italians honk car horns at every opportunity, so not sure there's really a "quiet" hotel room in the city..Never tried the breakfast here..saw the seating area outside for use as patio, but no one ever sat there. While the trolley & bus run in front of the hotel, good luck trying to use either one. Maybe early morning or late nite, otherwise packed. Just as well, walking is best of course. Like others, spent most of my time enjoying the sites, really just a place to lay my head at nite which served the purpose this trip. Plan to go back, but would choose another hotel in the future, closer to the city center w/ more restaurant choices, activities, options.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: 1vol
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff who were exceedingly helpful. Gave us great suggestions for walking tours of the area and good maps. Hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Termini or near trolley and bus routes. A little far from the Vatican but convenient to the Colosseum. Nice churches to tour nearby. Great little restaurant Tavola Calda in the circle nearby with a very friendly staff and great food at a reasonable price. Hotel was clean and nicely appointed. Walked all around the area all hours of the day and night with absolutely no problems. Don't let the appearance of graffiti scare you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Beautiful Double Room”
Reviews.Author: ARlady
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Donatello is in the "lower-priced tourist" area of Rome but we found the staff to be wonderful and very helpful. The first night the hotel was full so we were escorted by the owner over to another hotel. Once we returned to the Donatello the next day we were upgraded for our "trouble" to a beautiful double room. The bathroom was covered in marble, we had very nice bedding and drapes, and the ceiling was covered in stone. Very nice. Every morning the owner would offer an itinerary for us with a map and walking/metro tips. We loved this hotel and would stay here again. It is a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: tomoscharles
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Donatello on a weekend break with my husband. Very easy to find from the Termini Rail Station - Catch the 105 bus and it's 4 stops from there, just across the road. First impressions were 'iffy', like the real thing doesn't match any web photos! Area is a little run down, lots of graffiti but that's true of many areas of Rome. But, we were given a lovely little room with a nice bare brickwork ceiling, and all mod cons. Room was a little small but spotlessly clean. Breakfast however is a big let down. Just Croissants, french toast and honey or jam, in a rather non-atmospheric room in the basement. There is no restaurant or bar at the hotel. Location wise, it's not too bad as you can walk to the Colosseum in around 10 mins. Not much in the way of restaurants and bars close to the hotel so maybe not a good choice for lively guests. Saying that, the buses are very easy to use if you wish to travel to other parts of the city (and cheap or even free...nobody checks whether you validate your ticket on the machine in the bus). Would I return - maybe.... if they sorted their breakfast out and provided a bar! Overall, its good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel..just ok”
Reviews.Author: lovesublime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as part of a "build your own" vacation from Gate 1. The hotel was "as expected". Not in the city center, but not far from the metro station "Manzoni". It was very easy to get there from termini, we just had a hard time finding the hotel on th street. The location itself is not bad. Its about a 1mi walk to the Colusseum. There is a grocery store closeby, as well as a good resturant recommended by the staff called "the crazy sheep". Its calabrese food and very, very good! The staff was very friendly although we did not have much interaction with them. The complementary breakfast is kind of bleh...coffee and a roll, typical italian braskfast, just not what were used to! The rooms are very small but there was a huge closet. The beds were very hard, but not the worst Ive slept on in Europe. We had a small terrace right off our room which was nice but we didnt really use it. When youre sitting down you cant see the street anyway. I saw a few other posts mentioned road noise-we had no problem with this whatsoever. If youre on a budget this hotel is fine!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place”
Reviews.Author: gabesz
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to stay at this hotel. Although the hotel changed a bit since my last stay in 10 years, the entire experience was wonderful. The rooms are small overall, but clean and worked well for our purposes. Breakfast on the outside patio was a great experience. Worth the money compared to many other places we could have chosen instead of here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuggyNYC
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing here, though the location is sub par. My room was not ready when I arrived, so they arranged for me to stay at a 3 star hotel across the street for the first night. The manager even helped me carry my luggage and walked me over there. Rooms are very clean. It even has a mini fridge!! Breakfast room is also very nice, with an outdoor wing.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: OffseasonTrvler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a positive experience at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and spoke english well. As soon as we arrived the man working at the front desk offered us his suggestions of what to do while in Rome (since it was our first trip) and he laid out a walking tour for us on the maps they provided. This was GREAT! We followed it and saw so much of the city in a short time. The rooms were nice and clean and the bathrooms are a good size, clean and modern. It is a 15 minute walk from Termini train station but it is not the prettiest walk in town. As soon as we arrived we dropped our bags and walked to the Colloseum/Forum area and it only took about 15 minutes so we were happy with that. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A Roman gem”
Reviews.Author: esq_2k
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise as we had booked a trip to Rome and Paris on a budget through Gate 1 Travel (Travelzoo). We did not upgrade from the basic package. The hotel is conveniently located near bus and metro stations with a internet and international call center within a block. A large grocery store is within a 5- 10 minute stroll. The 20-25 room hotel while quaint is nicely decorated with marble floors and walls. The room had all the modern conveniences and was well appointed, ie. hair dryers, balcony, refrigerator, comfortable bed and pillows, satellite tv. Continental breakfast was served every morning with a very energetic staff and in a pleasing atmosphere.. The staff was friendly and spoke english rather well. The entrance is secured by a sliding glass door which can only be opened by the desk clerk. We felt quite safe at all hours. The guests that I met were from all over...US, England, Japan, some had stayed there previously. I would not hesistate for an instant to stay there again should I be fortunate enough to be able to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: sanfranciscotravelr
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why most are saying this hotel is good. My friend and I had a horrible experience at Donatello hotel. We did not feel safe at this hotel. Neighborhood looks shady and does not appear to be safe. Location is out of no where and away from all the attraction sites. Upon arriving, the receptionist gave us the room right next to the receptionist desk because they said that was the only room they had left. We requested a different room but they declined stating that they are all booked. There was so much noise with the door bell ringing from people coming in and out and it was hard for us to fall asleep considering we were both light sleepers. We can hear all the conversations at the receptionist desk between customers and receptionist. If you stay here, do not stay on floor 1 or basement floor by the breakfast room. Too noisy!!! Staff was not friendly at all and did not accomodate to our request. I was glad to only be there for 2 nights. Would not recommend this hotel at all and definitely will not return to this hotel when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the wrong neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: EddyThunderBay
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly good, small hotel but in what looks like a seedy neighbourhood, although we never felt nervous about walking around, even at night. Because the location is somewhat southeast of most of the attractions, know that you are going to be taking taxis or the metro at least some of the time. Most of our taxi fares were less than ten euros. The coliseum and forum is about a twenty minute walk from the hotel, and the train station is just over a kilometer away. The restaurants in the area are pretty good, which was very nice. I can't fault the room except the phone booth size shower. Our room faced the street so the street noise was an issue some nights. The gentlemen at the front desk were very helpful and we appreciated the free maps. We also appreciated that they arranged a limo ride to the airport for a reasonable price. We noticed that the hotel lobby is undergoing renovations, so the entrance should be much more inviting when that is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great little family-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: chitownchiu
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint little family-run hotel with a limited number of rooms but friendly service. Hotel room was small but everything is small in Europe. The breakfast here was excellent and rooms were clean. This was newly renovated when we went and the owner told us they were putting in an elevator. There is an excellent pizza place around the corner from the hotel in the Piazza di Maggiore! Internet cafe next to that as well if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: boa2005
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Donatello was picked for us by a friend as it is fairly cheap, central and just for a three-day break. We went as a group of three couples and had a warm welcome by the always friendly and effiicient staff. (Always impeccably dressed too, but this is Italy)! A recent and unusual downpour had left one room with water coming in and this was sorted out immediately. However, the road outside is not for light-sleepers. My husband and friends had to buy ear-plugs on the first day due to the ceaseless noisy traffic. There is a normal (long) road outside the hotel finishing at a round-about and the Italians like to sound their horns the minute a light changes. The centre of the road is used for trams which are also noisy. I had no trouble sleeping but the rest of the group did although I was woken each morning in time to catch breakfast early. Trying to use public transport in the first part of the morning is useless. Trams and the metro are like the underground in London - people queue to get on but can't. I was stood waiting next to an Italian woman and we both laughed when the doors of the tram opened to reveal potted people - the same shape as the door that had just encased them. To call a taxi was hit and miss although the hotel sorted this sometimes. Our room, number 408 had a hairdryer but this only works for a few seconds as it cuts out due to over-heating. Do I sound miserable? Sorry, I was not. I like the willingness of the staff to help, with a specially written out mini-tour for our last day. I liked Rome. I love the poeple, the food, the architecture and I felt safe when out and about. Of course one taxi driver took us round the long route and it helps if you speak the odd word of Italian (as I know this saved us having a large taxi fare one evening). We are tourists after all and I am sure it is the same everywhere. However, my husband found the hotel claustrophobic as it had no lobby, seating area or bar. I understand the restaurant is being re-furnished and is in the early stages of this but it also meant there was no bar. Being someone who only needs four or five hours sleep he was reduced to running up and down the marble stair-cases and through onto the busy street when the doors where open. The rooms are small and not a problem but they seem smaller as this is the only space available in the hotel apart from the stairs and breakfast room (open for breakfast only). Our last day meant leaving our bags with the manager. We returned for 2.30 p.m. and asked to use the toilet before the airport. We were told no - I don't think they had any other than those in the rooms - and were asked to go down the street to some public loos. It is a 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseo and there is a good restaurant round the corner but we would not stay here again. It is great is all you want is a crash-pad and don't mind noise but in this respect this is really a bed and breakfast rather than a hotel. We saw homeless people sleeping in the street and it seems this is on the outskirts of their China town. Not a problem if the hotel has more to it, but this was sadly not the case. I think my friends were happy though and I have fond memories. It would be boring if everywhere were the same!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: everfair
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Hotel Donatello for 4 nights, checking in March 9. I tried to prepare him as best as I could for European hotels (and continental breakfast) but he took it in stride. The staff welcomed and encouraged conversation in our limited Italian. Overall, while the room was small, it was comfortable to come home to. We had a little small balcony that was nice. We had two twin beds close together. The TV was a decent size (19 inch?) with clear reception. When we were in the room, we would turn on CNN. The bathroom was small, with the shower stall wedged in the corner. If you are claustrophobic, you might want to check it out before settling into the room to see if they can switch you. The towels were really more like tablecloths which was kind of odd for me. One very interesting feature is that they have tv speakers in the bathroom ceiling so you can still listen to the news while in the bathroom. Breakfast was fine. The cafe latte is wonderful. The crusty rolls were nice and warm, and the croissants were pretty satisfying. The breakfast room lady was very sweet. Our first morning there, the breakfast room manager took some time out to orient us and point out some nearby points of interest. It made for a very memorable and authentic morning (Santa Croce and San Giovanni churches are nearby). While the Manzoni station is still closed, Vittorio Emanuaele station is a very reasonable walk from the hotel. Obviously the hotel isn't in the middle of everything, but you can still get a glimpse of Romans going to work, hanging out, etc. There is a water fountain nearby...very convenient and money saving. The little shops along Via Porta Maggiore was good for picking up snacks. Try a "locals" restaurant (where the menu isn't translated into 5 different languages) on Via Manzoni (I think) called Bobo's. Great ambience and terrific food, all washed down with limoncello on the house!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MikethebikeWrexham
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel of the money. Plus points - immaculately clean - room even had a small balcony - fantastic friendly and helpful management. Minus points - our shower/WC was very small but our friends in next room had a large bathroom so pot luck I suppose. Main drawback is a little far out from the centre especially as the nearest tube station is currently closed. Also the area is pretty scruffy. From the outside the hotel looks basic but don't let this fool you it's fine inside. Overall - you won't get better value and friendlier staff but be prepared for a lot of walking!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Marrick-7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 4 night stay for 2 couples going to Rome for the first time. First impressions weren't great - a tiny and somewhat grubby canopy over a small glass door - but inside lots of shiny new marble and gleaming fixtures. Reception is cramped - but it was friendly and efficient. The outside door is kept locked - you ring a bell and the receptionist releases the door catch electronically - and we felt very safe. The rooms we had were very clean and finished to a high standard (inc. lcd tv with CNN and Eurosport in English) - much better than we expected for the budget price we paid. Breakfast is bread, croissants, packet toast and jam plus tea or coffee. We had to wait a few minutes one morning as the room cannot seat everyone at once. Although the location is not ideal, it isn't bad - particularly if you can get to grips with the buses and trams. A Rome 'bus ticket' will cover you for 75 mins travel including one metro ride - so you can get virtually anywhere for a euro - and there are bus stops just around the corner. Route 105 connects to the main train/metro/bus complex at Termini. Overall, we were very happy with our choice of the Donatello and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, clean.”
Reviews.Author: annabel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when the hotel we had actually booked had messed up our reservation. It was typical European 3 * hotel, Small lobby, breakfast room etc. We had a terrace off our room which was a bonus. The hotel was extremely clean. The owner greeted us when we were checking in and was very friendly and helpful in helping us get our bearings. The hotel is a good walk from the nearest metro station (extra long after a day walking around Rome). Not sure about the area as the street was deserted at night so would'nt recommend for solo travellers. Also the breakfast was fairly sparse, Croissant and coffee, no fruit or yogurt etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lexii
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a gem in Rome. The room was well appointed with attention to detail and we enjoyed the calm of the neighbourhood in which the hotel is situated. The place is really well worth recommending to fellow travelers, we noticed the owner always walking around and checking that his guests were well taken care of. By cab we were anywhere in the heart of Rome in about 5 minutes. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and personal”
Reviews.Author: msdon2
Reviews.Content: We recently spent several nights in the beginning of ourtrip and end of our trip at the Hotel Donatello. Having stayed with Carlo, Patrizia and staff 2 years ago, we knew we would not be disappointed. They were able to graciously accommodate us on 24 hours notice. We were situated in the newly renovated section of this charming and quaint hotel. The renovations and upgrades are first class all the way. You are always greeted by a kind face, warm words and many offers of help and advice. I suffered a debilitating sciatic attack during my stay in Rome and Carlo and his staff were there to attend to me in whatever way was needed, from finding a doctor to make a hotel call to checking to make sure I was ok. If you're walkers, the hotel really is situated within walking distance of ancient Rome. Maybe a 15 to 20 minute walk to the Colessium, Forum , etc. We used public transportation 2 years ago, but walked it this time and found it very easy and enjoyable. Several nice trattorias and pizzerias in the neighborhood that were more than adequate and reasonably priced. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Donatello should we ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: grumpycamel
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Hotel Donatello and was pleasantly suprised at this little hotel. We had ground floor connecting rooms which were spotlessly clean and comfortable. There is a lovely, small, bathroom with a great shower and the best bit an outdoor patio with garden furniture, great to be able to sit outside with a glass of wine after a long day walking round Rome! Walking you will defininitely have to do, it is further out from the main sights of Rome and if you don't mind walking it is fine, it is a 10 min walk to the metro and a 25 min walk to the Collosseum and it is a bit further than a 10 min walk from Termini. All the reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful, lending us umbrellas for some of the heaviest rain I have ever seen, finding us a corkscrew, ordering taxis and finding us somewhere to change after check out and coming back soaked to the skin! This is a great hotel if you are not bothered about nightlife and being in the centre of things, the two local restaurants have good food and are not expensive. The area is a bit grotty but we never felt unsafe and were quite happy to walk around and use the local transport. I would certainly stay here again on a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit hard to find”
Reviews.Author: JulesR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in August and as other reviewers have mentioned it's a bit tricky to find from Termini Station - the taxi driver had to ask his friend where the road was and noone will know where Hotel Donatello is, so don't lose the address. Maps at the hotel front desk don't all have the hotel marked on them (too far out!) The hotel is extremely nice. Our room on the top floor was immaculate and could be reached by the new elevator. The bathroom was very modern even if the jacuzzi bath didn't bubble. Airconditioning, flat screen TV and safe all working well. Breakfast is taken in the little garden in a beautiful location but there is just coffee a croissant, roll and jams. You can ask for very weak orange juice. Conclusion - a nice hotel in a suburban area. You can walk 2 mins to Porte Maggiore and there's a good tram no. 3 there. It's not a beatiful area of Rome, but not the worst. PS. The area is a bit dodgy and about 10 mins walk from a metro. Beware pickpockets when walking around the streets - we had an unskilled one try who was very obvious and halfhearted!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Caliswift
Reviews.Content: Location: About 5-8 minutes from the closest subway, about 1-2 minutes from bus stop. Plentiful, good restaurants near the hotel. Some sort of Nunary across the street. Fairly dark and vacant at night, which may lead to a scary walk but had not problems the 5 nights I was there. Room: Very small as expected like most European rooms. The bathroom was immaculately clean and up to date. The shower was very warm and powerful albeit small. The TV was larger than normal (about 19") and had speakers throughout the room and even the bathroom! The bed was comfortable and large. Had an odd little, useless patio that looked out to an uninspiring little courtyard. There was bread and coffee free of charge in the mornings...nothing else. The coffee was great though! The service was wonderful. The older gentalmen with the short, gray hair was very helpful. Everyone spoke great English and was more than willing to help with phone calls or directions. At the time of our trip there was no elevator (thank god we got a 1st floor room). The front room was inconstruction for what I assume is a tiny elevator. This lead to tons of noise and dust in the breakfast area. It was not a problem at night.

Reviews.Title: “Left a sour taste”
Reviews.Author: rachlwar
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel is a bit out of the way and an all-day bus/metro ticket (4 euro/person/day) was helpful.
