The hotel was reasonably priced and the rooms were clean and -- thankfully -- well air-conditioned. The owner is friendly (sometimes TOO friendly as he offered myself and my female friend rides on his motorbike and took to complimenting our looks a little too much for my liking). He was helpful, however, in giving us the lay of the land and suggesting things to do. Things went a little sour at the end of our stay. We left our bags in a storage area for the day while we went exploring. When we returned in the afternoon, one of our big backpacks had gone missing. I asked the man at the desk (in Italian) if there is an "overflow" area for bags and he assured me that there was not. He said that "someone must have accidentally taken our bag". He was extremely unhelpful and unapologetic. I asked if there was any way to get in touch with the individual he thought had taken our bag and he looked at me as if I was crazy. He insisted that this wasn't his problem as he had just come on duty at 1:00 and we had left our bags earlier in the day. After much frustration and going around in circles with the man at the desk (probably about half-an-hour), a light seemed to go off with one of the housekeepers and she remembered moving several bags to a different room. Our bag was there and all turned out well, but even as we were walking out the door the man at the front desk was yelling after us that this wasn't his fault because he didn't come on duty until 1:00. There is obviously some missing communication there. One other note about the neighborhood. Very nearby is the San Lorenzo area which has some good -- and different -- restaurants. We ate at Arancia Blu and Uno e Bino and were very happy at both and both were very close to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, but small rooms. Private bathroom was a fine size but could have been cleaner. Beware the incredibly thin towels! The breakfast was spartan but tasty, served in a delightful outdoor area. The location was a little far removed and required a bit of walking, but not unmanagable. The English-speaking staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 10 mins from Termini, quiet area. Staff speak relevant English phrases. Breakfast can be taken inside or in their gorgeous courtyard. Rooms were clean and airy, but there were few restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Donatello for four nights at the end of May. We had a double room with private bathroom for around €165 per night , breakfast included. This was quite expensive considering the hotel is not exactly very central. We left it very late to book accommodation so didn't have many options. The hotel itself is quite nice, the rooms are spacious and extremely clean. We also had a little balcony which was nice to sit out on with a pizza and some wine at night. There was air conditioning in the room which was very welcome. The big downside for us was that the elevator wasn't working for our entire stay, and our room was on the fourth floor. After spending the whole day walking around Rome it is no fun walking up all those flights of stairs, or going up and down them just to get breakfast. It certainly wouldn't be recommended for eldery people or anyone with small children or babies. The owner told us the elevator would be fixed in "a couple of days" but there's no doubt he's been saying that for the past while back. There are renovations going on (still) throughout the hotel but we didn't hear any noise early in the morning etc. The breakfast is served in a nice little courtyard and included a croissant, a scone, coffee, and some biscuits. You would definitely need to get the metro , or a bus , into the centre of Rome from this hotel , particularly as you would do so much walking around the city during the day. The nearest metro stop is Manzoni and was also "under construction "... The next closest was about 10 mins walk away , but the metro is only €1 and is very frequent so we used it quite a lot to get around. It closes at 9pm though so we had to get a taxi back to the hotel a couple of nights which cost €8 from around the spanish steps to the hotel. The hotel is in a fairly quiet and isolated area, it didn't feel unsafe , just a little bit out of the way. The only places within walking distance are the Colesseum and maybe Termini too. The staff were fairly helpful, it's run by a husband and wife, we really only dealt with the man, who had good english and had no problems giving directions for anywhere we asked. For anyone going to stay in this hotel , the best ice cream parlour in rome is down the street from the hotel, Freddies palace. Not to be missed. I wouldn't mind staying in this hotel again if I had to, but I would definitely look for better value and more central accommodation first.

Reviews.Title: “A little advice for the single traveller”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not be the best and definately not the worst, but as a single traveller they were extremely helpful and kind and it was just needed as a place to rest my weiry legs at the end of much sightseeing. The showers were lovely and hot. My only recommendation would be to return from sightseeing at the end of the day via taxi - it was a long walk from the metro, then you can return late evening after an enjoyable meal and vino! Great location for sightseeing and taxi from centre of Rome no more than 8 euros! Money well spent. Enjoy and take care as you would in most capital cities!

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: MarkGodbolt
Reviews.Content: We arrived late (11pm), phoned hotel from airport to inform them of our delay. We received clear instructions on how to find the hotel from the train station (Termini Station only 10min walk away). On arrival at hotel, near midnight, greeted by very efficient and friendly gentleman, who gave us lots of useful maps and information. Room was at top of stairs, but we did not find it overly noisy. There were some renovations being done, but this did not disturb us at all,in fact we would love to go back to see the finished project. Breakfast was basic but filling and had the most amazing lattes!!!!!!!!!!!! All served by a most dapper gentleman with the biggest beaming smile ever seen on someone so early in the morning. (We think he was the owner) Enquiries on how to get to a major football match (Lazio V Roma derby) were expertly handled by the owner's son. He gave us exact bus/tram/metro links to take and we had a blast!!! As to this being in a dodgy area, we have to say that unlike other reviewers, we never "feared for our lives" in fact I have felt more unsafe in London. You have to be sensible when travelling in Rome, don't flash your cash or bling but this should be common sense to any experienced traveller. We have travelled all over the world including Africa and Asia and would say that the area this hotel is in, is fine. We walked every night in the area to sample the local eateries and never once felt threatened in the dark, however mind the dog pooh on the pavements!!! (Not exclusively in this area either!!) Never had a problem finding someone who spoke English and my attempts at Italian were not laughed at. This hotel is fantastically situated for all the main sights, 20min walk to the Colloseum and 5min walk to the nearest Metro, 1 min walk to the nearest bus/tram stop. Good walking shoes needed in Rome. On the outside the hotel could do with a lick of paint but as we discovered that is not unusual in Rome!!!! The dining area downstairs is so full of character we wished we could have taken evening meals there too and in fact may even remodel our own dining room on it!!! We have recommended this hotel to friends and family and will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Donatello!”
Reviews.Author: UTgirl0224
Reviews.Content: First off, the family that owns the hotel is amazing. They were more than happy to help us with anything and were quick to arrange a tour of Rome for us for the next day (we got in late the previous night). The cafe downstairs where breakfast is served is fantastic and so cute. This hotel will really do well once the renovations are done. The room was really nice also, see pictures attached! All in all, I would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dont take any notice of the negative reviews of the area that you have seen here - its over the top nonsense!! The area is fine - the hotel was good more importantly - its clean, the building is nice inside and the service is excellent. The manager was especially helpful to his guests and there were no problems whatsoever as regards the rooms. The hotel is undergoing renovation but with no problems to its guests. When i go back to Rome i will definitely book in again at the Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first bad sign was when the taxi driver had no idea where the hotel was. Then we are put in this little room in among renovations that were extremely loud. The neighbourhood is sketchy and there were times I feared for my life. The stairs were loud and we were put right beside the breakfast room so we had to put up with those italian boots up and down the stairs all morning...not to mention the early start the renovators had! It was the worst sleep ever, we felt so unsafe and we complained first thing in the morning. I must say the staff was amazing about the situation and transfered us to a four star hotel, not too far away. He even personally checked out our new room to make sure that it was alright! I am glad we left, he told us on the way to our new hotel that there was a "social house" behind the hotel...yeah...aka crack house! If we wanted anything to smoke...that is where to find it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A sleeper among the ruins”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This small but ample hotel is family owned and the family is wonderful. Carlos, Patricia and Paulo are constantly available to make your stay wonderful with a plethera of maps, suggestions and guidance. While the hotel is under renovation, it is and promises to be one of the most sought after in Rome. An internet cafe sits across the street for a more cost-effective way of contacting people than the phone. Breakfasts were the least likable in all our Italian hotels, but the atmosphere and personality far outweighed any thoughts of missing those wonderful meats and cheeses offered previously. Our room was beautifully decorated with a bidet and jacuzzi, all new, the minibar and safe where it is advisable to put your passports while sightseeing. Carlos and his family have all kinds of suggestions for meals and places to see. While we loved the sights, the ruins and the friendliness of most, Rome was not our favorite city. It was to us, like seeing New York or Phila. Again, the Red bus proved beneficial to see sights for only 12 Euro, the metro is one block down, colliseum a few blocks up the street, ruins everywhere within walking distance. Unfortunately, it wasn't possible to see the Vatican or Sistine Chapel since the weekend was free to all and the Ques were over two miles long. We did hear the Pope speak and give a blessing in St. Peter's Square, and the Pantheon was well worth the walk. Awesome. Restaurants right across from Pantheon offered great pasta dishes with a wonderful Limonice liquor after each meal. Again, mingle with the town's people and enjoy what each town has to offer by being one with the people. Talk to other countrymen and your adventure will be more exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Worst area possible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok but the area was disgusting. We were told that the hotel was in the centre of Rome which it is not. It was a 20 minute walk into the centre. The area of the hotel is the equivalent to London Kings Cross. Passing homeless, prosititutes graffiti and people sitting on the pavements. When we arrived the hotel said that there was no room for us even though we had booked it.(this has happened before as previously mentioned in someonelses review). We were then sent round the corner to another hotel which was terrible. We then had to check out at 10am, wait around until 12 to check in at the Donatello. Would never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Donatello - Probably the friendliest hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Discobarbie1971
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from our trip to Rome and our stay at the Donatello, near Porta Santa Maggiore. The hotel is run by some extremely helpful staff who couldn't do enough to make our stay enjoyable - within 5 minutes of walking through the door we'd got an itinerary planned, information on transportation to the centre of Rome and one of the nicest areas to visit in the evening (Trastevere). The hotel itself is clean, comfortable (much needed air conditioning) and secure, we had a room at the back of the hotel too so it was peaceful too (quite rare in Rome with the noisey traffic) . Breakfast is served in a courtyard (coffee, bread and croissants) and is more than enough to set you up for a busy day in Rome. The location is excellent for day tripping as it's only a few minutes from Manzoni metro and 2 stops or about 15-20 minutes walk from Termini. I would definintely recommend this hotel to a friend. The only downside to this hotel would be once the metro has closed at 11.30pm you either have to get a taxi or work out the bus/tram system - my own personal opinion though is this adds to the adventure! Fingers crossed the coins I threw into the Trevi will get me back to the Donatello very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but kind of scary part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid March. Half of the hotel appeared to be under construction. Our room was at the very top of the stairs, and the very last room at the end of the hall. Ouch!!! The room was very tiny, the bathroom was nice and clean, but our beds were hard as rocks. There was also a horrid sewer smell coming from our bathroom that never went away. Also, our bathroom towels weren't much for drying. They appeared to be table linens. My husband and I each had a single bed that we tried our hardest to push together, but they wouldn't stay. Not very romantic! It was a 10 minute walk to the main termini station or the closest subway stop in either direction. The hotel isn't located in the best side of town. Lots of graffiti and homeless people in cardboard boxes and telephone booths. It wasn't the best walk to make back to your hotel at night. We were told by the hotel staff that it would be a 30 minute walk to the Colliseum, but we made it in 15. The breakfast wasn't much, but we really enjoyed it every morning. You had a choice of tea or coffee with a basket of 2 croissants and 2 rolls with assorted jellies and honey. I woul recommend this hotel to budget travelers who don't mind being in a slightly shady part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and fun: Hotel Donatello is a definite return!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the city of Rome, and to say in the least, hotel donatello made my stay comfortable and easy!!! I was nervouse about transportation and getting around. but, the family owned hotel made my stay enjoyable. they suggested what to do, when, and how. breakfast was small, but the help they have their do their best, and its noticeable. the room, may have been small, but we had a balcony. it was just good enough. After a long day, the room was perfect to relax in. I would definately come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TenbyPembrokeshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel on outskirts of city 10 mins from Termini station and Metro Not much to go on from outside but beautiful interior Lots of stairs to climb but lift is under constuction and will make all the differance .Marble floors etc small rooms very comfortable excellent showers Owner and family run Gave us good advice on where eat and how to get about Would definately return

Reviews.Title: “Interesting location, and oh those stairs!”
Reviews.Author: EdinColorado
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the small side, but spotlessly clean. Too far for us to walk from Termini Station, but an easy taxi ride and, once you get oriented, the light rail stop a few doors down is handy. The owner was very cordial and recommended a nearby walk to the Church of Santa Croce in Gerusalemme and then a few blocks more to San Gioanni in Laterno, where the popes once lived. Wonderful walk to an area we hadn't seen before. Breakfast was disappointing, with not much more than coffee and a roll. . . . and, oh those stairs to the room. OUCH!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were told that we had to move hotels because they did not have the room we booked avaliable. The daytime staff was helpful, however, we experienced very rude treatment by the nighttime staff. The location was not safe to walk around at night. Graffiti was everywhere and it was not a nice area. Accomendations were reasonably clean but sparse compared other places that we have stayed in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Cal97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Donatello in March 05. The rooms were fairly basic but clean and comfortable. Some have marble floors which are really really cold when you get out of bed in the morning. Breakfast is good - amazing floor in breakfast room. The best thing about this hotel is the friendly and helpful staff. They speak English and French and their advice was invaluable in helping us make the most of a short stay. They recommended a restaurant to us which we would have never have gone in otherwise and it was excellent. Ten minutes walk from Stazione Termini and 15-20 minutes Colosseum. Nearest metro 5-10 mins. Hotel allows you to leave bags once you have checked out if you have time before outward flight. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, okay room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donetello for 2 nights in early March. The price you can't beat for Rome and the location wasn't bad. The busses are a block away and the subway about 3 blocks. The staff was wonderful. They were the nicest out of all the hotels we stayed at. The room though, wasn't that great. We had a triple which consisted of 3 twin beds shoved together. One of the comforters had a dried blood spot on it, luckily that wasn't my bed. The shower was large, and nice, however there was this bad smell that eminated from the bathroom. We had to plug the bidet and that seemed to help. It was clean though and we were just there to sleep.
